header.#text: Appointment by Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court

text.#text: In any matter before a covered court involving a significant interpretation or construction of a provision of this Act, including any novel legal, factual, or technological issue or an issue relating to the Fourth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States, the court shall appoint one or more public interest advocates appointed under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to represent the privacy and civil liberties interests of the people of the United States in the matter before the court.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: paragraph (5) of section 1061(d) of the Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Intelligence Reform and Terrorism Prevention Act of 2004/s:1061/ss:d/p:5

text.#text: A court that appoints a public interest advocate for a matter before the court under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: with a summary of the issues in such matter that warranted such appointment.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board

text.#text: A public interest advocate appointed under
shall participate fully in the matter before the court for which such public interest advocate was appointed with the same rights and privileges as the Federal Government;

shall represent the interests of the people of the United States in preserving privacy and civil liberties in such matter, including with respect to the impact of such matter on the rights of the people of the United States under the Fourth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States;

shall have access to all relevant evidence in such matter and may petition the court to order the Federal Government to produce documents, materials, or other evidence necessary to perform the duties of the public interest advocate;

may file timely motions and briefs, in accordance with the procedures of the court, and shall be given the opportunity by the court to respond to motions or filings made by the Federal Government in accordance with such procedures; and
may request a rehearing or en banc consideration of a decision of the court.
